p: A study of the cytokine profile of patients in the acute and chronic phases of CHIKF identified dramatically elevated levels of IL-12 in chronic patients [ 64]. IL-12 is essential for the synthesis of Th1 lymphocytes, acting as a growth factor for natural killer (NK) cells, increasing their cytotoxic action [ 69]. In the synovial tissue analysis of patients with CCA, there was evidence of active monocyte/macrophage trafficking and several abnormal histological findings in the synovial membrane, including synovial lining hyperplasia, vascular proliferation, and infiltration of macrophages [ 64].
